Kajian Preferensi Tarif Impor AS dari RI Kelar Bulan Ini
06 Nov 2019, 11:54 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Wamenlu Mahendra Siregar. (Dok. GAPKI).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pemerintah menuturkan kajian perpanjangan sistem tarif preferensial umum bea masuk impor (Generalized System of Preference/GSP) dari AS ditargetkan selesai bulan ini. Wakil Menteri Luar Negeri (Wamenlu) Mahendra Siregar mengatakan diskusi antara dua negara masih berlanjut dan diharapkan selesai dalam waktu dekat."Kalau komitmen saya ke presiden kan satu bulan, dari waktu dilantik," katanya, Selasa (5/11).Untuk diketahui, GSP merupakan program unilateral AS berupa pembebasan tarif bea masuk ke pasar AS. Saat ini, AS memberikan fasilitas GSP kepada 121 negara dengan total 5.062 pos. Dari jumlah tersebut, Indonesia mendapatkan jatah sebanyak 3.572 pos tarif.Selama kajian berjalan, Mahendra bilang produk-produk sebelumnya tetap mendapatkan preferensi tarif. Ia bilang persyaratan yang diminta AS untuk perpanjangan tarif dinilai dalam batas wajar."Jadi sebenarnya yang kami harapkan untuk segera selesai, supaya permanen," ucapnya.Sebelumnya, lima produk ekspor Indonesia berhasil mendapatkan kembali fasilitas GSP dari Negeri Paman Sam. Informasi ini disampaikan secara resmi di laman resmi United States Trade Representative (USTR) .Mengutip keterangan resmi Kementerian Perdagangan, kelima produk tersebut adalah plywood bambu laminasi (HS 44121005), plywood kayu tipis kurang dari 66 mm (HS 44123141155), bawang bombai kering (HS 09082220), sirup gula, madu buatan, dan karamel (HS 17029052), serta barang rotan khusus untuk kerajinan tangan (HS 46021223).USTR melalui Komisi Perdagangan Internasional AS telah melakukan penilaian terhadap produk ekspor yang mendapatkan fasilitas GSP sejak April 2019. Proses penilaian dilakukan terhadap negara-negara mitra AS seperti Pakistan, Thailand, Brasil, Ekuador, Brasil, dan Indonesia.Pada 2018, ekspor Indonesia yang menggunakan fasilitas GSP tercatat sebanyak US$2,13 miliar dari total ekspor Indonesia ke AS sebesar US$18,4 miliar. Pada periode Januari--Desember 2018, Indonesia bisa menghemat sebanyak US$101,8 juta melalui pemanfaatan GSP.Jumlah penghematan ini meningkat sebesar US$23 juta atau 29 persen dibandingkan tahun 2017 yang tercatat sebesar US$78,8 juta. (ulf/age)

Study on US Import Tariff Preference from RI finished this month
Nov 6 2019, 11:54 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Mahendra Siregar. (Doc. Of GAPKI).

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The government said that the study to extend the general preferential tariff system for import duties (Generalized System of Preference / GSP) from the US is targeted to be completed this month. Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs (Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs) Mahendra Siregar said the discussion between the two countries is still continuing and is expected to be completed in the near future. GSP is a unilateral US program in the form of exemption from import duty tariffs into the US market. At present, the US provides GSP facilities to 121 countries with a total of 5,062 posts. Of this amount, Indonesia received a total of 3,572 tariff posts. During the study, Mahendra said that the previous products still received tariff preferences. He said the requirements requested by the US for extension of tariffs were considered to be within reasonable limits. "So what we really expect is to finish soon, so that they are permanent," he said. This information was conveyed officially on the official website of the United States Trade Representative (USTR). Quoting the official statement of the Ministry of Trade, the five products are laminated bamboo plywood (HS 44121005), thin wood plywood less than 66 mm (HS 44123141155), dried onions (dried onions (HS 44123141155), dried onions (dried onions) HS 09082220), sugar syrup, artificial honey, and caramel (HS 17029052), as well as special rattan goods for handicrafts (HS 46021223) .USTR through the US International Trade Commission has conducted an assessment of export products that have received GSP facilities since April 2019. Process The assessment was carried out on US partner countries such as Pakistan, Thailand, Brazil, Ecuador, Brazil and Indonesia. In 2018, Indonesian exports using the GSP facility were recorded at US $ 2.13 billion of Indonesia's total exports to the US amounting to US $ 18.4 billion . In the January-December 2018 period, Indonesia could save as much as US $ 101.8 million through the use of GSP. This amount of savings increased by US $ 23 million or 29 percent compared to 2017 which was recorded at US $ 78.8 million. (ulf / age)
